description_templates.default: Get Geyser as a plugin, as in the [setup guide](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/setup/). Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config (either by setting it yourself, or enabling "clone-remote-port") and connect with the same IP and port as you would on Java.

built_in.name: Aternos
built_in.description:
Select as a plugin in the Aternos plugin list and connect to your server with your Java IP and port. See [Aternos's article](https://support.aternos.org/hc/en-us/articles/360051047631) for more details. 
 Do note: Aternos automatically installs the latest version of the plugin, but does not auto update it. To update Geyser on aternos, simply reinstall the plugin (no need to uninstall the plugin/deleting the plugin files).

built_in.name: Apex Hosting
built_in.description: Full auto installation. Go to the `Customizations` tab in the panel and select `Enabled` under the `Geyser Auto Installer` option then restart and connect to your server with your Java IP and port. See [Apex's article](https://apexminecrafthosting.com/geysermc/) for more details.

built_in.name: Cloud Nord
built_in.description: Go to their [Crossplay Server](https://cloudnord.net/minecraftcrossplay-server-hosting/) hosting section and simply order your server. Instructions on how to join are provided.

built_in.name: CreeperHost
built_in.description: Has a toggle within the control panel to automatically enable Geyser. May not be enabled by default, so you may need to toggle it and restart the server.

built_in.name: Cubes Hosting
built_in.description: Install Geyser as a plugin from the plugin manager configure with the correct port then restart the server and Geyser works out of the box as expected.

built_in.name: exaroton
built_in.description: Select as a plugin in the exaroton plugin list and connect to your server with your Java IP and port. See [exaroton's article](https://support.exaroton.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019857918-Geyser) for more details.

built_in.name: FreeMcServer.net
built_in.description: Can be selected from the reinstall tab of the control panel.

built_in.name: GGServers
built_in.description: Can easily be installed to any server in just one click from their auto plugin setups. No configuration needed.

built_in.name: MCProHosting
built_in.description: Click "Enable Bedrock Support" on the server dashboard and follow the steps. For manual installation: Add Destination Port 19132 with Protocol UDP to the port forward mapping and connect to the given source port.

built_in.name: Minefort
built_in.description: On the server dashboard under "Connect Support", make sure "Allow Bedrock" is enabled. Then simply connect via `play.minefort.com` and join using `/server <servername>`, or connect via `<servername>.minefort.com`.

built_in.name: Minehut
built_in.description: Connect via `bedrock.minehut.com` and do `/join <servername>`, or connect directly via `<servername>.bedrock.minehut.gg`.

built_in.name: OMGServ
built_in.description: Select Geyser in [Install Menu](https://i.imgur.com/Gewpsrq.png), all is automatically installed. You can turn on/off floodgate in [server properties on the dashboard](https://i.imgur.com/jg5mzNj.png).

built_in.name: PloudOS
built_in.description: Connect via `geyser.ploudos.com` and enter the with your Java IP and port. See [PloudOS's article](https://ploudos.com/faq/#How-do-I-connect-from-Bedrock-to-a-Java-server) for more details.

built_in.name: Pufferfish Host
built_in.description: Geyser is installed and configured on all servers by default.

built_in.name: Server.pro
built_in.description: On VPS, select Geyser in the [Service Type Menu](https://i.imgur.com/loSNmvu.png), Floodgate can be enabled and disabled on the dashboard configuration. For manual installation: If using a Premium or Free plan, use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in the configuration file and connect with the same port; for the Free plan, also enable the `clone-remote-port` option; leave the IP values as default (`0.0.0.0` and `auto`). However, if you are using a PRO or a VPS plan, you can use any port you'd like, which can be opened on the Firewall tab.

built_in.name: Snakecraft Hosting
built_in.description: Select "Paper + Geyser with Floodgate" under the Jar Type at checkout to install the Geyser plugin. Players will Connect with the same IP and port as you would on Java.

built_in.name: SRKHOST
built_in.description: You can enable Geyser at the Version changer page. This feature is built-in and uses the given port by the host.

built_in.name: Virtual Gladiators
built_in.description: Find the plugin in the control panel under the "VG Recommended" category and restart your server. IP and port are the same as Java.

built_in.name: ZapHosting
built_in.description: Find the plugin in the control panel and restart your server. IP and port is the same as Java.

built_in.name: 365Hosts
built_in.description: Go to their [Minecraft: Crossplay](https://www.365hosts.com/gaming/crossplayminecraft) hosting section and simply order your server. Instructions on how to join are provided.

support.name: Akliz
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. They should have a port forwarding option that works.

support.name: Aquatis
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Need to open a support ticket to get UDP ports and then update the config to reflect your new Bedrock port.

support.name: Azure
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Not a dedicated Minecraft service provider.

support.name: BisectHosting
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Need to ask to open a UDP port, and set the Bedrock address in the config to the Java IP. To open a UDP port, you need to have a dedicated IP.

support.name: Bloom.Host
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. They have a port forwarding option that works.

support.name: Clovux
support.description: Make sure your remote address is 'auto' and your bedrock address is your server IP.

support.name: Craft-Hosting
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port; note that this provider appears to only provide service in Russia.

support.name: DedicatedMC
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Need to ask to open the default bedrock port.

support.name: ExtraVM
support.description: Make sure your remote address and your bedrock address is your server IP.

support.name: FadeHost
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port or buy a dedicated IP address to support a different port.

support.name: FakaHeda
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server or use one of the available ports allocated for your server, for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: FalixNodes
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Open a port yourself on the network page in the game panel, then change the port under the bedrock section of the Geyser config.

support.name: Ferox Hosting
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Open a port yourself in our panel and check out the [knowledgebase](https://feroxhosting.nl/kb/) for how to install and configure the plugin.

support.name: Futurehosting
support.description: Make sure your `bedrock` `address` in your Geyser config is your server IP.

support.name: Google Cloud
support.description:
Not a dedicated Minecraft provider
  - 90 day/$300 free trial
  - 
  - Note: You'll need to also allow port 19132 on UDP, use Paper instead of vanilla, and put Geyser in the plugins folder
  - You also don't need an SSD, they're just trying to make you pay more

support.name: GPortal
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Need to ask to open a UDP port. Also, make sure your `bedrock` `address` in your Geyser config is your server IP.

support.name: Heavynode
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use default port and 0.0.0.0 as the address. 19132 is blocked for DDOS reasons so your best bet is to use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port. Also, see [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser)

support.name: Hetzner
support.description: Not a dedicated Minecraft provider.

support.name: Hicoria
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the one of the available ports allocated for your server, for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: HostEZ
support.description: Geyser plugin supported with self-install or installed on request with its own port. Includes firewall tested to be compatible with Geyser.

support.name: HumbleServers
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config, or one of the two extra ports, and connect with that port. If the subdomain doesn't work, use your regular numbered IP address.

support.name: Meloncube
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Need to ask to open a UDP port.

support.name: Minehub
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port, or buy a dedicated IP address to support a different port.

support.name: Netbela
support.description: Install Geyser as a plugin with the dedicated Plugin installer. Use the same port as your Java server in your config. Connect using the same address and port as your Java server.

support.name: NFOservers
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Make sure your remote address and your bedrock address are your server IP in the Geyser config file. As an alternative, you can run Geyser standalone separately on an Unmanaged VDS.

support.name: NiCraft
support.description:
Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.
  - See [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser).
  - So if your players encounter this issue, please ask them to try to connect (even if they don't have Minecraft) from Java Edition first while their Bedrock client is opened, and after they should be able to join on Bedrock Edition.

support.name: Nitrado
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Add 4 to the Port of the Java server. See [here](https://wiki.nitrado.net/en/How_to_install_GeyserMC_and_Floodgate) for specific instructions.

support.name: Nodecraft
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the default server port and 0.0.0.0 or your server IP as the host address.

support.name: Oracle Cloud / OCI
support.description:
Not a dedicated Minecraft provider
  - 30 day/$300 free trial
  - [Tutorial for a Minecraft server in Oracle Cloud](https://blogs.oracle.com/developers/post/how-to-set-up-and-run-a-really-powerful-free-minecraft-server-in-the-cloud)
  - Note: You'll need to also allow port 19132 on UDP in both the security list and the firewall-cmd command, use Paper instead of vanilla, and put Geyser in the plugins folder.
 -- Note for Ubuntu users: Comment out `-A INPUT -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-host-prohibited` in `/etc/iptables/rules.v4` and run `sudo iptables-restore < /etc/iptables/rules.v4` to fix ufw.

support.name: OVH
support.description: See [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#issues-connecting-with-ovh-or-a-subsidiary).

support.name: Pebblehost
support.description: See [this video](https://youtu.be/v9lC80UBZF4) for a PebbleHost-specific tutorial.

support.name: PUBCS

Get Geyser as a plugin, as in the [setup guide](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/setup/). Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config (either by setting it yourself, or enabling "clone-remote-port". Connect with the same IP and port as you would on Java. 
  - See [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser).
  - So if your players encounter this issue, please ask them to try to connect (even if they don't have Minecraft) from Java Edition first while their Bedrock client is opened, and after they should be able to join on Bedrock Edition.

support.name: SunriseNode

support.name: ScalaCube

For Geyser Standalone installation instructions, see [here](https://shockbyte.com/billing/knowledgebase/173/Introduction-to-GeyserMCorDragonProxy-How-GeyserMC-Works.html).

support.name: SoYouStart

support.name: STIPE

support.name: SyntexHosting
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in the config and connect with that port, or request a (free) additional port for your bedrock clients.

support.name: The Minecraft Hosting
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. 19132 should work as a Bedrock port, if not use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: Titan Nodes
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the default server port and 0.0.0.0 as the host address.

support.name: WinterNode
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port, request an additional port, or buy a dedicated IP address.
